comments:
If I use the "new-ejb-project" - Wizzard, after pressing the "Finish"-Button I 
get - depending on some circumstances - a bug-dialog-window with the stack-
trace shown below. If you want to enforce the bug to appear, you have to fill 
the "new-ejb-project" - wizzard like this:

1)Target-Server: your Server
2)ejb-Version: your ejb-Version
3)add Module to an ear - Application: no
4)create an ejb-client jar.. : yes
5)add support for annotated java - classes: yes.

The occurence of the bug is depending on the three values you select for the 
yes/no - fields mentioned above with the numbers 3), 4), 5). In the example I 
gave above the submitted values are no, yes, yes. If you play around with these 
values, you have 2*2*2 possibilities. I tested all of them and found the 
following two patterns for receiving the bug: the first one is the pattern I 
gave above (no, yes, yes) and the second is (no, yes, no). The value for Target-
Server and ejb-Version doesn seem to play a role for the bug because I got the 
same results for JBOSS 3.2.3 with EJB 2.0 and for GERONIMO 1.0 with EJB 2.1. 
Here's the stack-Trace of the bug:

The reason for this exception is because the ejb client jar is being create with
Add to EAR unchecked. An EJB Client jar should not be allowed to be created for
a standalone EJB module. Fix released will be available in the next integration
build

in tutorial "Building a Simple EJB Application" the checkbox "Add module to an 
EAR application" is unchecked while the checkbox "create EJB client jar..." is 
checked. This case should not be allowed if you are right.

That is right, the tutorial needs to be fixed and that condition should not be 
allowed

Verified in build M-1.5.1-200609211736, following David W's request for a group verification effort. The problem combination of wizard settings is no longer possible (create EJB client option disabled if not added to EAR).
